tag_list: womens-media, womens-health, womens-websites, atomic-online, sheknows-com, scrum, agile-development, agile, product-development, project-management, scrummaster, certified-scrum-practitioner, web-development, web-management
overview:
Tony Pagliocco is Digital Reserach Inc’s Director of Technology. Tony brings 11 years of web engineering and online media experience, with a focus on emerging technologies. In his role at Digital Research Inc (DRI), he is responsible for the organization, implementation and management of new and existing technological systems and teams.

Prior to DRI, Tony Pagliocco joined SheKnows.com, a division of Atomic Online, in mid 2007 as the Director of Web Technology & Product Development. Atomic Online is a multi-media and technology company with revenue over $20 million and a portfolio of over 30 owned & operated websites. Atomic’s websites roll-up under 4 major hub properties: CraveOnline.com, SheKnows.com, GameRevolution.com, and theFashionSpot.com.

Tony oversaw the SheKnows team of 40 employees and 100+ contractors and freelancers responsible for editorial, operations, business development, marketing, ad sales, product development, web engineering, agile development coaching, and strategic planning.

Tony evangelizes Agile practices in the workplace and as a result has had his team release extraordinary custom products for clients such as General Mills, JC Penny, Fisher Price, NBC, and ACS.

Tony joined SheKnows from vSocial where as the Senior Implementation Engineer he helped in development, implementation, and release of the social video networking platform.

Prior to vSocial, Tony spent 5 years at Arizona State University in the Physics and Astronomy Department, working as Senior Analyst for the HORUS and ORION Space Mission Research teams. Working alongside analysts from JPL, NASA, and other institutions, Tony provided web application development, system administration, and database support for all team members.

Tony holds a BS from Arizona State University in Computer Science and currently resides in Maine with his wife Jody and two kids, Nic and Mariah.
